heroSection.title: MIRa-NRW
heroSection.excerpt: Reporting & Information Centre anti-Black anti-Asian and other forms of racism NRW
heroSection.description: Have you been a victim or witness of a racist attack or discrimination ? You can report your case to us anonymously

card.description: Together, we have made significant strides towards equality and justice. Join us as we celebrate the milestones achieved, partnerships formed, and the positive changes we have initiated. With your continued support, we are building bridges and creating lasting change in our communities. Explore the report to learn more about our accomplishments and our vision for a future free from racial discrimination.

initialStep.title: Have you become a victim or witness of a racist attack or discrimination ?
initialStep.subTitle: You can report your case to us anonymously
initialStep.description: Your report will make racism visible in NRW!

datenschutz.title: Data Protection Notice
datenschutz.firstParagraph: The use of the online reporting form is voluntary. All content-related information is collected and processed anonymously. During the processing of the reporting form, to the extent permitted by your browser, an access log is set, without which online data collection would not function. However, this is automatically deleted immediately upon completion of the session, i.e., after filling out and submitting the form.
datenschutz.secondParagraph: If you close the browser window without completing the survey, the session cookie will be automatically deleted after twelve hours. Important note on completing the form: Please do not provide specific names or data of other individuals that would allow for their identification. If it would be possible to identify individual persons, this data will be deleted during pseudonymization and replaced with coded values.
datenschutz.thirdParagraph: The information you provide will be used exclusively by the MIRa-NRW reporting office for the purpose of recording discrimination incidents in NRW. Raw data will not be published or shared with third parties.
datenschutz.secondAgreement: I do not agree to the specified data protection regulations and hereby terminate my report.

firstStep.disclaimer: If you are filling out the reporting form on behalf of someone else, it means that you are completing the form from the perspective of the affected person and in accordance with their self-disclosure. If this is not the case and you want to report an incident from your perspective as a witness, please click the 'Another person' option above.
firstStep.disclaimerAgreement: I hereby confirm that I am entering the following information on behalf of the affected person. I am completing this reporting form on their behalf and have their consent. All information will be filled out in accordance with the wishes and statements of the affected person. I hereby confirm that I am entering the following information on behalf of the affected person. I certify that I am completing all information truthfully under the authorization of the affected person.

whoIsAffected.title: Who is affected ?*
whoIsAffected.thirdOption: I am reporting on behalf of the affected person

firstStep.organizationTypeQuestion: What type of organization/institution is affected (multiple answers possible) ?
firstStep.numberOfEmployeesQuestion: How many people work in the organization/institution (full-time, part-time, or volunteer) ?

whoIsAffectedOnBehalfQuestion.firstOption: What is the gender identity of the affected person ?
whoIsAffectedOnBehalfQuestion.secondQuestion: How old is the affected person ?

secondStep.whenDidIncidentTakePlace: When did the incident take place ?
secondStep.happenedOverALongPeriod: It happened over a long period of time.
secondStep.inWhichPlace: In which place did the discrimination occur ?
secondStep.inWhichPlaceHint: (Please enter here only the city or district no address)
secondStep.whichSocialSphere: In which societal sphere did the discrimination occur ? (Multiple answers possible)*

description.title: Incident Description – What exactly happened ?*
description.placeholder: Please describe the incident as precisely as possible. For data protection reasons, we ask you not to provide names or data of other persons here.

hints.title: Relevant information may include:
hints.item1: Where did the discrimination take place ?
hints.item2: Who was the target of the attack ?
hints.item3: How was the organization/institution discriminated against ?
hints.item4: Who was the perpetrator of the attack ?
hints.item6: What makes you think it is anti-Asian racism ?
hints.item7: What were the effects of the incident (e.g., emotional, physical, social, or financial effects) ?

otherFormOfDiscrimination.title: Is it another form of discrimination ?

isItReported.title: Has the organization/institution taken any other measures ?
dataYes: They reported the case to the police

manifestation.titleQuestion: In what way did discrimination based on (attributed) Asian heritage manifest ?

data.value: I was harassed, bullied, insulted, or harassed
data.name: racismManifestation
data.label: I was harassed, bullied, insulted, or harassed
data.examples: e.g., insult related to my (attributed) Asian heritage | harassment in public

data.name: racismManifestation
data.label: I experienced sexual harassment
data.examples: e.g., exoticization | over or desexualization due to my (attributed) Asian heritage

data.value: I was subtly humiliated or degraded in an everyday situation
data.name: racismManifestation
data.label: I was subtly humiliated or degraded in an everyday situation
data.examples: e.g., attribution of negative or 'positive' traits only with reference to my (attributed) Asian heritage | confrontation with 'Asian sounds or gestures' | blame related to Corona | not taking seriously or ridiculing due to my (attributed) Asian heritage | being avoided | questioning my belonging to Germany

data.value: I experienced digital violence or discrimination
data.name: racismManifestation
data.label: I experienced digital violence or discrimination
data.examples: e.g., hate speech | cyber-stalking

data.name: racismManifestation
data.label: I experienced violence
data.examples: e.g., physical assault or coercion | arson | break-in at my home | destruction or damage to property

data.name: racismManifestationIWasDisadvantaged
data.label: I did not receive access
data.examples: e.g., no access to a club or event | no contract at a gym | entry into a club or group | denial of a loan agreement | renting an apartment

data.value: I did not receive equal treatment or equal service
data.name: racismManifestationIWasDisadvantaged
data.label: I did not receive equal treatment or equal service
data.examples: e.g., inadequate or denied medical treatment | unjustified inspection | lower grades in school | disadvantage at work | denial of social benefits by an office | higher rent compared to other tenants

data.name: racismManifestationIWasDisadvantaged
data.label: I was excluded
data.examples: e.g., expulsion or non-promotion in school | termination of employment or apartment | reassignment at work | eviction

data.value: The same rights were denied to me.
data.name: racismManifestationIWasDisadvantaged
data.label: The same rights were denied to me.
data.examples: e.g., residency status | recognition of a professional or educational qualification

data.value: I feel my personal rights have been violated
data.name: racismManifestationIWasDisadvantaged
data.label: I feel my personal rights have been violated
data.examples: e.g., mispronunciation or misspelling of my name | violation of my intimacy or privacy

leftSection.title: Get Support
leftSection.paragraph: Would you like to seek counseling for the reported incident ?
leftSection.firstLinkDescription: have been supporting victims of right-wing, racist, antisemitic, and other forms of inhuman (abbreviated: right-wing) violence in NRW since 2011/12.
leftSection.secondLinkDescription: advise and support people who have been discriminated against due to their origin, skin color, religion, or language.

rightSection.title: Download
rightSection.paragraph: You can download a summary of your report here.

faqs.question: Racism
faqs.answer: Racism originates from the historically evolved mindset that 'They' permanently differ from 'Us.' This sense of differentiation serves as the motive for 'We' to employ our power advantage to treat 'Others' in a manner that we would consider cruel or unjust if members of our own group were affected. Racism is therefore an expression of societal power relations that establish a system of differentiation, exclusion, restriction, or preference. This results in the thwarting, impairing, or denial of respecting, participating in, or exercising human rights in the political, social, economic, legal, cultural, or any other area of public or private life.

faqs.question: Anti-Black Racism
faqs.answer: Anti-Black racism is specifically directed against Black people. Its origins lie in the enslavement and exploitation of the African continent and its inhabitants. To justify the brutal colonization, Europeans declared Black people to be inferior, often pseudoscientifically justified. This was particularly based on physical characteristics, such as body shape or Afro hair. Anti-Black racism, due to the visibility of Blackness, especially in dark-skinned individuals, leads to regular psychological and physical experiences of violence in private and public life.

faqs.question: Anti-Asiatic Racism
faqs.answer: It is particularly specific to people to whom an Asian origin is attributed. It mostly concerns connections to South, Southeast, and East Asian countries. It manifests in narratives and prejudices and is evident in private and public life. Racism against individuals perceived as Asian is not new and is based on attitudes and narratives dating back to colonial times. It can go in various directions. On the one hand, people perceived as Asian in Germany are stigmatized as 'different' or 'dangerous.' On the other hand, there is the stereotype of 'hardworking model migrants.' Therefore, they are often denied experiences of racism.

cookiesConsent.title: Your privacy
cookiesConsent.content: For the operation of our portal, we exclusively use cookies that are necessary for operation. Further information can be found in the

heroSection.description: MIRa-NRW has taken the task of making anti-Asian racism, anti-black racism and other forms of racism more visible in NRW. MIRa-NRW will be operated by a merger of three organizations

firstSection.description: The VMDO (Association of Sociocultural Migrant Associations in Dortmund) understands itself as an association of associations and organizations that are autonomous but at the same time share common goals and principles. The VMDO aims to promote exchange and encounter of people with and without migration history and to enable personal acquaintance across cultures and promote the equal participation of all Dortmunders. At the same time, the VMDO understands itself as the voice of migrants and people with a refugee or migration background in Dortmund.

secondSection.description: The Anti-Racism Information Centre (ARIC-NRW) has been a recognised centre for anti-discrimination and racism-critical work for over 30 years. Since 1997, we have been providing advice to victims of discrimination, have many years of experience in observing and documenting racism and discrimination and are politically committed to better protection against discrimination.

thirdSection.description: The Landesverband Netwerke von Migrant*innenorganisationen in NRW e. V. (LV NeMO) consists of eight local associations of migrants*inner organisations (MO) in eight cities in NRV and is the representative organization of approximately 150 migrant*innerorganisations in NDR. Founded in 2018, the LV NeMO understands itself as the new political and social voice of a (post)migrant immigration society.

fourthSection.title: MIRa-NRW wants
fourthSection.firstSubsection: To document and analyse anti-black, anti-Asian and other forms of racist attacks such as incidents in NRW
fourthSection.secondSubsection: The forms, applications and consequences of discrimination and racism
fourthSection.thirdSubsection: to illuminate the dark field of anti-black, anti-Asian, other forms and multidimensional discrimination and racism and to reflect an up-to-date picture of discrimination & racism in NRW
fourthSection.fourthSubsection: Show affected people the way to counselling services

address.title: Office
address.description: Main location in the House of Diversity in the Unionviertel
